ZoomOut.helpDescription: The old content is "zoomed out", i.e. shrinks to a point at the center of the content area.

SlideOver.description: The new content slides in from the left while the old content slides out to the left at the same time.
SlideOver.helpDescription: The new content slides in from the left while the old content slides out to the left at the same time.

Rotate.description: The new content rotates in. (Just like one of those old newspaper-animations.)
Rotate.helpDescription: The new content rotates in. (Just like one of those old newspaper-animations.)

SlideRight.description: The new slides in from the left (to the right).
SlideRight.helpDescription: The new slides in from the left (to the right).

ZoomIn.description: The new content is "zoomed in" from the center and grows to fill the full content area.

None.description: No animation. Content is switched instantly.

legend.description: Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates. Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.
legend.helpDescription: Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates. Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

sap.ui.unified.calendar.DatesRow.description: renders a row of days with ItemNavigation This is used inside the calendar. Not for stand alone usage If used inside the calendar the properties and aggregation are directly taken from the parent (To not duplicate and sync DateRanges and so on...)
sap.ui.unified.calendar.DatesRow.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new calendar/DatesRow. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getStartDate startDate} : object
    • {@link #getDays days} : int (default: 7)
    • {@link #getShowDayNamesLine showDayNamesLine} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month#constructor sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.calendar.DatesRow.helpDescription: renders a row of days with ItemNavigation This is used inside the calendar. Not for stand alone usage If used inside the calendar the properties and aggregation are directly taken from the parent (To not duplicate and sync DateRanges and so on...)

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

selectedDates.description: Date Ranges for selected dates of the DatePicker
selectedDates.helpDescription: Date Ranges for selected dates of the DatePicker

specialDates.description: DateRange with type to visualize special days in the Calendar. Note: If one day is assigned to more than one DateTypeRange, only the first one will be used. The only exception is when one of the types is NonWorking, then you can have both NonWorking and the other type. For example, you can have NonWorking + Type01 but you can't have Type01 + Type02.
specialDates.helpDescription: DateRange with type to visualize special days in the Calendar. Note: If one day is assigned to more than one DateTypeRange, only the first one will be used. The only exception is when one of the types is NonWorking, then you can have both NonWorking and the other type. For example, you can have NonWorking + Type01 but you can't have Type01 + Type02.

date.description: A date as JavaScript Date object. The month including this date is rendered and this date is focused initially (if no other focus is set).
date.helpDescription: A date as JavaScript Date object. The month including this date is rendered and this date is focused initially (if no other focus is set).

showWeekNumbers.description: Determines whether the week numbers in the months are displayed. Note: For Islamic calendars, the week numbers are not displayed regardless of what is set to this property.
showWeekNumbers.helpDescription: Determines whether the week numbers in the months are displayed. Note: For Islamic calendars, the week numbers are not displayed regardless of what is set to this property.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

secondaryCalendarType.description: If set, the days are also displayed in this calendar type If not set, the dates are only displayed in the primary calendar type
secondaryCalendarType.helpDescription: If set, the days are also displayed in this calendar type If not set, the dates are only displayed in the primary calendar type

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.
busyIndicatorSize.helpDescription: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

showHeader.description: If set, a header with the month name is shown
showHeader.helpDescription: If set, a header with the month name is shown

intervalSelection.description: If set, interval selection is allowed
intervalSelection.helpDescription: If set, interval selection is allowed

singleSelection.description: If set, only a single date or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected
singleSelection.helpDescription: If set, only a single date or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

showDayNamesLine.description: If set the day names are shown in a separate line. If not set the day names are shown inside the single days.
showDayNamesLine.helpDescription: If set the day names are shown in a separate line. If not set the day names are shown inside the single days.

nonWorkingDays.description: If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6. If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days.
nonWorkingDays.helpDescription: If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6. If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days.

busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

firstDayOfWeek.description: If set, the first day of the displayed week is this day. Valid values are 0 to 6. If not a valid value is set, the default of the used locale is used.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

weekNumberSelect.description: Fired when a week number selection is changed. By default, choosing the week number will select the corresponding week. Note: Works for Gregorian calendars only and when intervalSelection is set to true.

validateFieldGroup.description: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or when the user explicitly pressed the key combination that triggers validation. sap.ui.unified.ShellHeadUserItem.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ShellHeadUserItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getUsername username} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getShowPopupIndicator showPopupIndicator} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getImage image} : sap.ui.core.URI
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.ui.unified.ColorPickerPopover.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ColorPickerPopover. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getColorString colorString} : string
    • {@link #getMode mode} : sap.ui.unified.ColorPickerMode (default: HSV)
    • {@link #getDisplayMode displayMode} : sap.ui.unified.ColorPickerDisplayMode (default: Default)
  • Events

sap.ui.unified.CalendarAppointment.description: An appointment for use in a PlanningCalendar or similar. The rendering must be done in the Row collecting the appointments. (Because there are different visualizations possible.) Applications could inherit from this element to add own fields.
sap.ui.unified.CalendarAppointment.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CalendarAppointment. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getTentative tentative} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSelected selected} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getKey key} : string
    • {@link #getColor color} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange#constructor sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.CalendarAppointment.helpDescription: An appointment for use in a PlanningCalendar or similar. The rendering must be done in the Row collecting the appointments. (Because there are different visualizations possible.) Applications could inherit from this element to add own fields.

specialDates.description: Dates or date ranges with type, to visualize special days in the Calendar. If one day is assigned to more than one Type, only the first one will be used. To set a single date (instead of a range), set only the startDate property of the {@link sap.ui.unified.DateRange} class. Note: Keep in mind that the NonWorking type is for marking specific dates or date ranges as non-working, where if you need a weekly-reccuring non-working days (weekend), you should use the nonWorkingDays property. Both the non-working days (from property) and dates (from aggregation) are visualized the same.
specialDates.helpDescription: Dates or date ranges with type, to visualize special days in the Calendar. If one day is assigned to more than one Type, only the first one will be used. To set a single date (instead of a range), set only the startDate property of the {@link sap.ui.unified.DateRange} class. Note: Keep in mind that the NonWorking type is for marking specific dates or date ranges as non-working, where if you need a weekly-reccuring non-working days (weekend), you should use the nonWorkingDays property. Both the non-working days (from property) and dates (from aggregation) are visualized the same.

disabledDates.description: Dates or date ranges for disabled dates. To set a single date (instead of a range), set only the startDate property of the {@link sap.ui.unified.DateRange} class.
disabledDates.helpDescription: Dates or date ranges for disabled dates. To set a single date (instead of a range), set only the startDate property of the {@link sap.ui.unified.DateRange} class.

minDate.description: Minimum date that can be shown and selected in the Calendar. This must be a JavaScript date object. Note: if the date is inside of a month the complete month is displayed, but dates outside the valid range can not be selected. Note: If the minDate is set to be after the maxDate, the maxDate is set to the end of the month of the minDate.
minDate.helpDescription: Minimum date that can be shown and selected in the Calendar. This must be a JavaScript date object. Note: if the date is inside of a month the complete month is displayed, but dates outside the valid range can not be selected. Note: If the minDate is set to be after the maxDate, the maxDate is set to the end of the month of the minDate.

pickerPopup.description: If set, the month- and yearPicker opens on a popup
pickerPopup.helpDescription: If set, the month- and yearPicker opens on a popup

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

intervalSelection.description: If set, interval selection is allowed
intervalSelection.helpDescription: If set, interval selection is allowed

singleSelection.description: If set, only a single date or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected
singleSelection.helpDescription: If set, only a single date or interval, if intervalSelection is enabled, can be selected

nonWorkingDays.description: If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6. If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days. Note: Keep in mind that this property sets only weekly-recurring days as non-working. If you need specific dates or dates ranges, such as national holidays, use the specialDates aggregation to set them. Both the non-working days (from property) and dates (from aggregation) are visualized the same.

sap.ui.unified.Calendar.description: Basic Calendar. This calendar is used for DatePickers
sap.ui.unified.Calendar.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Calendar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getIntervalSelection intervalSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSingleSelection singleSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMonths months} : int (default: 1)
    • {@link #getFirstDayOfWeek firstDayOfWeek} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getNonWorkingDays nonWorkingDays} : int[]
    • {@link #getPrimaryCalendarType primaryCalendarType} : sap.ui.core.CalendarType
    • {@link #getSecondaryCalendarType secondaryCalendarType} : sap.ui.core.CalendarType
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getMinDate minDate} : object
    • {@link #getMaxDate maxDate} : object
    • {@link #getShowWeekNumbers showWeekNumbers} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSelectedDates selectedDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateRange[]
    • {@link #getSpecialDates specialDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange[]
    • {@link #getDisabledDates disabledDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateRange[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.unified.CalendarLegend)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:cancel cancel} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:startDateChange startDateChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:weekNumberSelect weekNumberSelect} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.Calendar.helpDescription: Basic Calendar. This calendar is used for DatePickers

specialDates.description: Dates or date ranges with type, to visualize special days in the Calendar. If one day is assigned to more than one Type, only the first one will be used. To set a single date (instead of a range), set only the startDate property of the {@link sap.ui.unified.DateRange} class. Note: Keep in mind that the NonWorking type is for marking specific dates or date ranges as non-working, where if you need a weekly-reccuring non-working days (weekend), you should use the nonWorkingDays property. Both the non-working days (from property) and dates (from aggregation) are visualized the same.

sap.ui.unified.MenuTextFieldItem.description: Special menu item which contains a label and a text field. This menu item is e.g. helpful for filter implementations. The aggregation submenu (inherited from parent class) is not supported for this type of menu item.
sap.ui.unified.MenuTextFieldItem.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new MenuTextFieldItem element. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getLabel label} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getValue value} : string
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase#constructor sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.MenuTextFieldItem.helpDescription: Special menu item which contains a label and a text field. This menu item is e.g. helpful for filter implementations. The aggregation submenu (inherited from parent class) is not supported for this type of menu item.

sap.ui.unified.Menu.description: A menu is an interactive element which provides a choice of different actions to the user. These actions (items) can also be organized in submenus. Like other dialog-like controls, the menu is not rendered within the control hierarchy. Instead it can be opened at a specified position via a function call.
sap.ui.unified.Menu.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Menu control. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAriaDescription ariaDescription} : string
    • {@link #getMaxVisibleItems maxVisibleItems} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getPageSize pageSize} : int (default: 5)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:itemSelect itemSelect} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.Menu.helpDescription: A menu is an interactive element which provides a choice of different actions to the user. These actions (items) can also be organized in submenus. Like other dialog-like controls, the menu is not rendered within the control hierarchy. Instead it can be opened at a specified position via a function call.

maxVisibleItems.description: The maximum number of items which are displayed before an overflow mechanism takes effect. A value smaller than 1 means an infinite number of visible items. The overall height of the menu is limited by the height of the screen. If the maximum possible height is reached, an overflow takes effect, even if the maximum number of visible items is not yet reached.
maxVisibleItems.helpDescription: The maximum number of items which are displayed before an overflow mechanism takes effect. A value smaller than 1 means an infinite number of visible items. The overall height of the menu is limited by the height of the screen. If the maximum possible height is reached, an overflow takes effect, even if the maximum number of visible items is not yet reached.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.
busyIndicatorSize.helpDescription: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

pageSize.description: The keyboard can be used to navigate through the items of a menu. Beside the arrow keys for single steps and the Home / End keys for jumping to the first / last item, the Page Up / Page Down keys can be used to jump an arbitrary number of items up or down. This number can be defined via the pageSize property. For values smaller than 1, paging behaves in a similar way to when using the Home / End keys. If the value equals 1, the paging behavior is similar to that of the arrow keys.
pageSize.helpDescription: The keyboard can be used to navigate through the items of a menu. Beside the arrow keys for single steps and the Home / End keys for jumping to the first / last item, the Page Up / Page Down keys can be used to jump an arbitrary number of items up or down. This number can be defined via the pageSize property. For values smaller than 1, paging behaves in a similar way to when using the Home / End keys. If the value equals 1, the paging behavior is similar to that of the arrow keys.

enabled.description: When a menu is disabled none of its items can be selected by the user. The enabled property of an item (@link sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase#getEnabled) has no effect when the menu of the item is disabled.
enabled.helpDescription: When a menu is disabled none of its items can be selected by the user. The enabled property of an item (@link sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase#getEnabled) has no effect when the menu of the item is disabled.

For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. validateFieldGroup.description: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or when the user explicitly pressed the key combination that triggers validation. By default, the RETURN key without any modifier keys triggers validation, see {@link #triggerValidateFieldGroup}. Listen to this event to validate data of the controls belonging to a field group. See {@link #setFieldGroupIds}, or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

ariaLabelledBy.description: Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).
ariaLabelledBy.helpDescription: Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

legend.description: Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates. Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.
legend.helpDescription: Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates. Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

sap.ui.unified.calendar.TimesRow.description:
Renders a row of time items using ItemNavigation. There is no paging or navigation outside the rendered area implemented. This is done inside the CalendarTimeInterval. If used inside the CalendarTimeInterval the properties and aggregation are directly taken from the parent (to not duplicate and synchronize DateRanges and so on...).

The TimesRow works with JavaScript Date objects.
sap.ui.unified.calendar.TimesRow.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TimesRow. It shows a calendar with time granularity (normally hours) Note: This is used inside the CalendarTimeInterval, not for standalone usage. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDate date} : object
    • {@link #getStartDate startDate} : object
    • {@link #getItems items} : int (default: 12)
    • {@link #getIntervalMinutes intervalMinutes} : int (default: 60)
    • {@link #getIntervalSelection intervalSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSingleSelection singleSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowHeader showHeader} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSelectedDates selectedDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateRange[]
    • {@link #getSpecialDates specialDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.unified.CalendarLegend)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:focus focus} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.calendar.TimesRow.helpDescription:
Renders a row of time items using ItemNavigation. There is no paging or navigation outside the rendered area implemented. This is done inside the CalendarTimeInterval. If used inside the CalendarTimeInterval the properties and aggregation are directly taken from the parent (to not duplicate and synchronize DateRanges and so on...).

The TimesRow works with JavaScript Date objects.

date.description: A date as JavaScript Date object. The month including this date is rendered and this date is focused initially (if no other focus is set). If the date property is not in the range startDate + items in the rendering phase, it is set to the startDate. So after setting the startDate the date should be set to be in the visible range.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

intervalMinutes.description: Size of on time interval in minutes, default is 60 minutes. Note: the start of the interval calculation is always startDat at 00:00. An interval longer than 720 minutes is not allowed. Please use the DatesRow instead. A day must be divisible by this interval size. One interval must not include more than one day.

sap.ui.unified.Shell.description: The shell control is meant as root control (full-screen) of an application. It was build as root control of the Fiori Launchpad application and provides the basic capabilities for this purpose. Do not use this control within applications which run inside the Fiori Lauchpad and do not use it for other scenarios than the root control usecase.
sap.ui.unified.Shell.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Shell. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getShowCurtain showCurtain} : boolean
    • {@link #getShowCurtainPane showCurtainPane} : boolean
    • {@link #getSearchVisible searchVisible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getCurtainContent curtainContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getCurtainPaneContent curtainPaneContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getHeadItems headItems} : sap.ui.unified.ShellHeadItem[]
    • {@link #getHeadEndItems headEndItems} : sap.ui.unified.ShellHeadItem[]
    • {@link #getSearch search} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getUser user} : sap.ui.unified.ShellHeadUserItem
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.unified.ShellLayout#constructor sap.ui.unified.ShellLayout} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.Shell.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.44.0 undefined
The shell control is meant as root control (full-screen) of an application. It was build as root control of the Fiori Launchpad application and provides the basic capabilities for this purpose. Do not use this control within applications which run inside the Fiori Lauchpad and do not use it for other scenarios than the root control usecase.

sap.ui.unified.ShellHeadItem.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ShellHeadItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getStartsSection startsSection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowSeparator showSeparator} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSelected selected} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getToggleEnabled toggleEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowMarker showMarker} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month.description: renders a month with ItemNavigation This is used inside the calendar. Not for stand alone usage If used inside the calendar the properties and aggregation are directly taken from the parent (To not duplicate and sync DateRanges and so on...)
sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new calendar/Month. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDate date} : object
    • {@link #getIntervalSelection intervalSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSingleSelection singleSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowHeader showHeader} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFirstDayOfWeek firstDayOfWeek} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getNonWorkingDays nonWorkingDays} : int[]
    • {@link #getPrimaryCalendarType primaryCalendarType} : sap.ui.core.CalendarType
    • {@link #getSecondaryCalendarType secondaryCalendarType} : sap.ui.core.CalendarType
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getShowWeekNumbers showWeekNumbers} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSelectedDates selectedDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateRange[]
    • {@link #getSpecialDates specialDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange[]
    • {@link #getDisabledDates disabledDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateRange[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.unified.CalendarLegend)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:focus focus} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:weekNumberSelect weekNumberSelect} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month.helpDescription: renders a month with ItemNavigation This is used inside the calendar. Not for stand alone usage If used inside the calendar the properties and aggregation are directly taken from the parent (To not duplicate and sync DateRanges and so on...)

selectedDates.helpDescription: Date Ranges for selected dates of the DatePicker

specialDates.description: DateRange with type to visualize special days in the Calendar. Note: If one day is assigned to more than one DateTypeRange, only the first one will be used. The only exception is when one of the types is NonWorking, then you can have both NonWorking and the other type. For example, you can have NonWorking + Type01 but you can't have Type01 + Type02.

The only exception is when one of the types is NonWorking, then you can have both NonWorking and the other type. For example, you can have NonWorking + Type01 but you can't have Type01 + Type02.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.ui.unified.CalendarRow.helpDescription: A calendar row with a header and appointments. The Appointments will be placed in the defined interval.

appointments.description: Appointments to be displayed in the row. Appointments outside the visible time frame are not rendered. Note: For performance reasons, only appointments in the visible time range or nearby should be assigned.

intervalHeaders.description: Appointments to be displayed in the top of the intervals. The intervalHeaders are used to visualize public holidays and similar things. Appointments outside the visible time frame are not rendered. The intervalHeaders always fill whole intervals. If they are shorter than one interval, they are not displayed. Note: For performance reasons, only appointments in the visible time range or nearby should be assigned.
intervalHeaders.helpDescription: Appointments to be displayed in the top of the intervals. The intervalHeaders are used to visualize public holidays and similar things. Appointments outside the visible time frame are not rendered. The intervalHeaders always fill whole intervals. If they are shorter than one interval, they are not displayed. Note: For performance reasons, only appointments in the visible time range or nearby should be assigned.

groupAppointmentsMode.description: Defines the mode in which the overlapping appointments are displayed. Note: This property takes effect, only if the intervalType of the current calendar view is set to sap.ui.unified.CalendarIntervalType.Month. On phone devices this property is ignored, and the default value is applied.
groupAppointmentsMode.helpDescription: Defines the mode in which the overlapping appointments are displayed. Note: This property takes effect, only if the intervalType of the current calendar view is set to sap.ui.unified.CalendarIntervalType.Month. On phone devices this property is ignored, and the default value is applied.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.
busyIndicatorSize.helpDescription: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

nonWorkingHours.description: If set, the provided hours are displayed as non-working hours. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 23. (Other values will just be ignored.) Note: The non working hours are only visualized if intervalType is set to hour.
nonWorkingHours.helpDescription: If set, the provided hours are displayed as non-working hours. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 23. (Other values will just be ignored.) Note: The non working hours are only visualized if intervalType is set to hour.

showIntervalHeaders.description: If set, interval headers are shown like specified in showEmptyIntervalHeaders. If not set, no interval headers are shown even if intervalHeaders are assigned.
showIntervalHeaders.helpDescription: If set, interval headers are shown like specified in showEmptyIntervalHeaders. If not set, no interval headers are shown even if intervalHeaders are assigned.

nonWorkingDays.description: If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6. (Other values will just be ignored.) If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days. Note: The non working days are only visualized if intervalType is set to day.
nonWorkingDays.helpDescription: If set, the provided weekdays are displayed as non-working days. Valid values inside the array are 0 to 6. (Other values will just be ignored.) If not set, the weekend defined in the locale settings is displayed as non-working days. Note: The non working days are only visualized if intervalType is set to day.

checkResize.description: If set, the CalendarRow checks for resize by itself. If a lot of CalendarRow controls are used in one container control (like PlanningCalendar). the resize checks should be done only by this container control. Then the container control should call handleResize of the CalendarRow if a resize happens.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

appointmentsVisualization.helpDescription: Defines the visualization of the CalendarAppoinment Note: The real visualization depends on the used theme.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

appointmentsReducedHeight.description: If set the appointments without text (only title) are rendered with a smaller height. Note: On phone devices this property is ignored, appointments are always rendered in full height to allow touching.
appointmentsReducedHeight.helpDescription: If set the appointments without text (only title) are rendered with a smaller height. Note: On phone devices this property is ignored, appointments are always rendered in full height to allow touching.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). showSubIntervals.description: If set, subintervals are shown. If the interval type is Hour, quarter hours are shown. If the interval type is Day, hours are shown. If the interval type is Month, days are shown.
showSubIntervals.helpDescription: If set, subintervals are shown. If the interval type is Hour, quarter hours are shown. If the interval type is Day, hours are shown. If the interval type is Month, days are shown.

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

intervals.description: Number of displayed intervals. The size of the intervals is defined with intervalType
intervals.helpDescription: Number of displayed intervals. The size of the intervals is defined with intervalType

intervalType.description: Type of the intervals of the row. The default is one hour.
intervalType.helpDescription: Type of the intervals of the row. The default is one hour.

showEmptyIntervalHeaders.description: If set, interval headers are shown even if no intervalHeaders are assigned to the visible time frame. If not set, no interval headers are shown if no intervalHeaders are assigned. Note: This property is only used if showIntervalHeaders is set to true.
showEmptyIntervalHeaders.helpDescription: If set, interval headers are shown even if no intervalHeaders are assigned to the visible time frame. If not set, no interval headers are shown if no intervalHeaders are assigned. Note: This property is only used if showIntervalHeaders is set to true.

updateCurrentTime.description: If set the CalendarRow triggers a periodic update to visualize the current time. If a lot of CalendarRow controls are used in one container control (like PlanningCalendar) the periodic update should be triggered only by this container control. Then the container control should call updateCurrentTimeVisualization of the CalendarRow to update the visualization.
updateCurrentTime.helpDescription: If set the CalendarRow triggers a periodic update to visualize the current time. Then the container control should call updateCurrentTimeVisualization of the CalendarRow to update the visualization.

Constructor for a new DateTypeRange. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.unified.DateRange#constructor sap.ui.unified.DateRange} can be used as well.

sap.ui.unified.ColorPicker.description: Enables the user to select a color. The color can be defined using HEX, RGB, or HSV values or a CSS color name. Note: Keep in mind that this control needs either sap.m or sap.ui.commons library to be loaded in order to work as it depends on controls available in one or the other library.
sap.ui.unified.ColorPicker.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ColorPicker. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getColorString colorString} : string
    • {@link #getMode mode} : sap.ui.unified.ColorPickerMode (default: HSV)
    • {@link #getDisplayMode displayMode} : sap.ui.unified.ColorPickerDisplayMode (default: Default)
  • Aggregations
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.unified.Currency.description:
A text view which displays currency values and aligns them at the decimal point.

Overview

The currency control consists of an amount, which is formatted automatically according to the user’s locale (using delimiter symbols for the decimal point and thousand separators) and to the currency set for this specific number (number of decimal places). The currency is expressed as a three-letter code.

Usage

When to use
  • To display amounts with different currencies in a vertical layout, such as in a table, list, or form, and it is important that the user is able to compare the amounts.
When not to use
  • To display amounts with the same currency in a table. Use the {@link sap.m.ObjectNumber} instead.
  • to display a number with a unit of measurement that is not a currency. Use the {@link sap.m.ObjectNumber} instead.
  • To display an amount in a structure other than a list, table, or form.

Responsive behavior

The control supports amounts smaller than 100 trillion, which still fit on a phone screen in portrait mode. For larger amounts, the unit of measurement wraps to the next line, which makes it difficult to compare the amounts.
sap.ui.unified.Currency.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Currency. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getValue value} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getStringValue stringValue} : string
    • {@link #getCurrency currency} : string
    • {@link #getMaxPrecision maxPrecision} : int (default: 3)
    • {@link #getUseSymbol useSymbol} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.Currency.helpDescription:
A text view which displays currency values and aligns them at the decimal point.

Overview

The currency control consists of an amount, which is formatted automatically according to the user’s locale (using delimiter symbols for the decimal point and thousand separators) and to the currency set for this specific number (number of decimal places). The currency is expressed as a three-letter code.

Usage

When to use
  • To display amounts with different currencies in a vertical layout, such as in a table, list, or form, and it is important that the user is able to compare the amounts.
When not to use
  • To display amounts with the same currency in a table. Use the {@link sap.m.ObjectNumber} instead.
  • to display a number with a unit of measurement that is not a currency. Use the {@link sap.m.ObjectNumber} instead.
  • To display an amount in a structure other than a list, table, or form.

Responsive behavior

The control supports amounts smaller than 100 trillion, which still fit on a phone screen in portrait mode. For larger amounts, the unit of measurement wraps to the next line, which makes it difficult to compare the amounts.

stringValue.description: Determines the currency value as a string. String value is useful if you want to store really big values. If there are more than 21 digits before the decimal point or if the number starts with “0.” followed by more than five zeros, it is represented in exponential form. In these cases use the stringValue property to keep the number in decimal format. Note: If set, it will take precedence over the value property.

sap.ui.unified.SplitContainer.description: Provides a main content and a secondary content area
sap.ui.unified.SplitContainer.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new SplitContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowSecondaryContent showSecondaryContent} : boolean
    • {@link #getSecondaryContentSize secondaryContentSize} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 250px)
    • {@link #getSecondaryContentWidth secondaryContentWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 250px)
    • {@link #getOrientation orientation} : sap.ui.core.Orientation (default: Horizontal)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
    • {@link #getSecondaryContent secondaryContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

legend.description: Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates. Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.
legend.helpDescription: Association to the CalendarLegend explaining the colors of the specialDates. Note The legend does not have to be rendered but must exist, and all required types must be assigned.

sap.ui.unified.calendar.MonthsRow.description:
Renders a row of months using ItemNavigation. There is no paging or navigation outside the rendered area implemented. This is done inside the CalendarMonthInterval. If used inside the CalendarMonthInterval the properties and aggregation are directly taken from the parent (to not duplicate and synchronize DateRanges and so on...).

The MontsRow works with JavaScript Date objects, but only the month and the year are used to display and interact. As representation for a month, the 1st of the month will always be returned in the API.
sap.ui.unified.calendar.MonthsRow.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new MonthsRow. It shows a calendar with month granularity Note: This is used inside the CalendarMonthInterval, not for standalone usage. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDate date} : object
    • {@link #getStartDate startDate} : object
    • {@link #getMonths months} : int (default: 12)
    • {@link #getIntervalSelection intervalSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSingleSelection singleSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowHeader showHeader} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSelectedDates selectedDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateRange[]
    • {@link #getSpecialDates specialDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.unified.CalendarLegend)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:focus focus} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.calendar.MonthsRow.helpDescription:
Renders a row of months using ItemNavigation. There is no paging or navigation outside the rendered area implemented. This is done inside the CalendarMonthInterval. If used inside the CalendarMonthInterval the properties and aggregation are directly taken from the parent (to not duplicate and synchronize DateRanges and so on...).

The MontsRow works with JavaScript Date objects, but only the month and the year are used to display and interact. As representation for a month, the 1st of the month will always be returned in the API.

selectedDates.description: Date ranges for selected dates. If singleSelection is set, only the first entry is used. Note: Even if only one day is selected, the whole corresponding month is selected.
selectedDates.helpDescription: Date ranges for selected dates. If singleSelection is set, only the first entry is used. Note: Even if only one day is selected, the whole corresponding month is selected.

specialDates.description: Date ranges with type to visualize special months in the row. If one day is assigned to more than one type, only the first one will be used. Note: Even if only one day is set as a special day, the whole corresponding month is displayed in this way.
specialDates.helpDescription: Date ranges with type to visualize special months in the row. If one day is assigned to more than one type, only the first one will be used. Note: Even if only one day is set as a special day, the whole corresponding month is displayed in this way.

date.description: A date as JavaScript Date object. The month including this date is rendered and this date is focused initially (if no other focus is set). If the date property is not in the range startDate + months in the rendering phase, it is set to the startDate. So after setting the startDate the date should be set to be in the visible range.

The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.ui.unified.ContentSwitcher.description: Switches between two control areas and animates it via CSS transitions
sap.ui.unified.ContentSwitcher.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ContentSwitcher. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getAnimation animation} : string (default: None)
    • {@link #getActiveContent activeContent} : int (default: 1)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent1 content1} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getContent2 content2} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.ContentSwitcher.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.44.0 undefined

See the types sap.ui.unified.ContentSwitcherAnimation for default implementations.

sap.ui.unified.MenuItem.description: Standard item to be used inside a menu. A menu item represents an action which can be selected by the user in the menu or it can provide a submenu to organize the actions hierarchically.
sap.ui.unified.MenuItem.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new MenuItem element. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getText text} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: )
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase#constructor sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.MenuItem.helpDescription: Standard item to be used inside a menu. A menu item represents an action which can be selected by the user in the menu or it can provide a submenu to organize the actions hierarchically.

sap.ui.unified.calendar.MonthPicker.description: renders a MonthPicker with ItemNavigation This is used inside the calendar. Not for stand alone usage
sap.ui.unified.calendar.MonthPicker.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new MonthPicker. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getMonth month} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getMonths months} : int (default: 12)
    • {@link #getIntervalSelection intervalSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getColumns columns} : int (default: 3)
    • {@link #getPrimaryCalendarType primaryCalendarType} : sap.ui.core.CalendarType
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSelectedDates selectedDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateRange[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:pageChange pageChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.calendar.MonthPicker.helpDescription: renders a MonthPicker with ItemNavigation This is used inside the calendar. Not for stand alone usage

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.ui.unified.calendar.YearPicker.description: renders a YearPicker with ItemNavigation This is used inside the calendar. Not for stand alone usage. As in all date-time controls, all pubic JS Date objects that are given (e.g. setDate()) or read (e.g. getFirstRenderedDate) with values which are considered as date objects in browser(local) timezone.
sap.ui.unified.calendar.YearPicker.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new YearPicker. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getYear year} : int (default: 2000)
    • {@link #getYears years} : int (default: 20)
    • {@link #getIntervalSelection intervalSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getColumns columns} : int (default: 4)
    • {@link #getDate date} : object
    • {@link #getPrimaryCalendarType primaryCalendarType} : sap.ui.core.CalendarType
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSelectedDates selectedDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateRange[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:pageChange pageChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.calendar.YearPicker.helpDescription: renders a YearPicker with ItemNavigation This is used inside the calendar. Not for stand alone usage. As in all date-time controls, all pubic JS Date objects that are given (e.g. setDate()) or read (e.g. getFirstRenderedDate) with values which are considered as date objects in browser(local) timezone.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. sap.ui.unified.ShellLayout.description: The shell layout is the base for the shell control which is meant as root control (full-screen) of an application. It was build as root control of the Fiori Launchpad application and provides the basic capabilities for this purpose. Do not use this control within applications which run inside the Fiori Lauchpad and do not use it for other scenarios than the root control usecase.
sap.ui.unified.ShellLayout.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ShellLayout. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowPane showPane} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getHeaderHiding headerHiding} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getHeaderVisible headerVisible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
    • {@link #getPaneContent paneContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getHeader header} : sap.ui.core.Control
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.ShellLayout.helpDescription:

The shell layout is the base for the shell control which is meant as root control (full-screen) of an application. It was build as root control of the Fiori Launchpad application and provides the basic capabilities for this purpose. Do not use this control within applications which run inside the Fiori Lauchpad and do not use it for other scenarios than the root control usecase.

sap.ui.unified.calendar.Header.description: renders a calendar header The calendar header consists of 3 buttons where the text can be set and a previous and a next button. In the normal calendar the first button contains the displayed day, the second button the displayed month and the third button the displayed year. Note: This is used inside the calendar. Not for standalone usage
sap.ui.unified.calendar.Header.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Header. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTextButton0 textButton0} : string
    • {@link #getAdditionalTextButton0 additionalTextButton0} : string
    • {@link #getAriaLabelButton0 ariaLabelButton0} : string
    • {@link #getVisibleButton0 visibleButton0} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTextButton1 textButton1} : string
    • {@link #getAdditionalTextButton1 additionalTextButton1} : string
    • {@link #getAriaLabelButton1 ariaLabelButton1} : string
    • {@link #getVisibleButton1 visibleButton1} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getTextButton2 textButton2} : string
    • {@link #getAdditionalTextButton2 additionalTextButton2} : string
    • {@link #getAriaLabelButton2 ariaLabelButton2} : string
    • {@link #getVisibleButton2 visibleButton2} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnabledPrevious enabledPrevious} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnabledNext enabledNext} : boolean (default: true)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:pressPrevious pressPrevious} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:pressNext pressNext} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:pressButton0 pressButton0} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:pressButton1 pressButton1} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:pressButton2 pressButton2} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.calendar.Header.helpDescription: renders a calendar header The calendar header consists of 3 buttons where the text can be set and a previous and a next button. In the normal calendar the first button contains the displayed day, the second button the displayed month and the third button the displayed year. Note: This is used inside the calendar. Not for standalone usage

sap.ui.unified.CalendarTimeInterval.description: Calendar with granularity of time items displayed in one line.
sap.ui.unified.CalendarTimeInterval.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CalendarTimeInterval. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getStartDate startDate} : object
    • {@link #getIntervalSelection intervalSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSingleSelection singleSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getItems items} : int (default: 12)
    • {@link #getIntervalMinutes intervalMinutes} : int (default: 60)
    • {@link #getPickerPopup pickerPopup} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMinDate minDate} : object
    • {@link #getMaxDate maxDate} : object
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSelectedDates selectedDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateRange[]
    • {@link #getSpecialDates specialDates} : sap.ui.unified.DateTypeRange[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getLegend legend} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.unified.CalendarLegend)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:cancel cancel} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:startDateChange startDateChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

intervalMinutes.description: Size of on time interval in minutes, default is 60 minutes. Note: the start of the interval calculation is always on the corresponding date at 00:00. By default, the RETURN key without any modifier keys triggers validation, see {@link #triggerValidateFieldGroup}. Listen to this event to validate data of the controls belonging to a field group. See {@link #setFieldGroupIds}, or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.
validateFieldGroup.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

ariaDescribedBy.description: Association to controls / IDs which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).
ariaDescribedBy.helpDescription: Association to controls / IDs which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).
