sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.description: The framework generates an input field and a button with text "Browse ...". The API supports features such as on change uploads (the upload starts immediately after a file has been selected), file uploads with explicit calls, adjustable control sizes, text display after uploads, or tooltips containing complete file paths.
sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FileUploader. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getValue value} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUploadUrl uploadUrl} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: )
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: )
    • {@link #getUploadOnChange uploadOnChange} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAdditionalData additionalData} : string
    • {@link #getSameFilenameAllowed sameFilenameAllowed} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getButtonText buttonText} : string
    • {@link #getFileType fileType} : string[]
    • {@link #getMultiple multiple} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMaximumFileSize maximumFileSize} : float
    • {@link #getMimeType mimeType} : string[]
    • {@link #getSendXHR sendXHR} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder} : string
    • {@link #getStyle style} : string
    • {@link #getButtonOnly buttonOnly} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getUseMultipart useMultipart} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMaximumFilenameLength maximumFilenameLength} : int
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getValueStateText valueStateText} : string
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: )
    • {@link #getIconHovered iconHovered} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: )
    • {@link #getIconSelected iconSelected} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: )
    • {@link #getIconFirst iconFirst} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIconOnly iconOnly} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getParameters parameters} : sap.ui.unified.FileUploaderParameter[]
    • {@link #getHeaderParameters headerParameters} : sap.ui.unified.FileUploaderParameter[]
    • {@link #getXhrSettings xhrSettings} : sap.ui.unified.FileUploaderXHRSettings
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:uploadComplete uploadComplete} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:typeMissmatch typeMissmatch} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:fileSizeExceed fileSizeExceed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:fileEmpty fileEmpty} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:fileAllowed fileAllowed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:uploadProgress uploadProgress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:uploadAborted uploadAborted} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:filenameLengthExceed filenameLengthExceed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:uploadStart uploadStart} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.helpDescription: The framework generates an input field and a button with text "Browse ...". The API supports features such as on change uploads (the upload starts immediately after a file has been selected), file uploads with explicit calls, adjustable control sizes, text display after uploads, or tooltips containing complete file paths.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

headerParameters.description: The header parameters for the FileUploader which are only submitted with XHR requests. Header parameters are not supported by Internet Explorer 9.
headerParameters.helpDescription: The header parameters for the FileUploader which are only submitted with XHR requests. Header parameters are not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

xhrSettings.description: Settings for the XMLHttpRequest object. Note: This aggregation is only used when the sendXHR property is set to true.
xhrSettings.helpDescription: Settings for the XMLHttpRequest object. Note: This aggregation is only used when the sendXHR property is set to true.

tooltip.description:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.
tooltip.helpDescription:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.

customData.description: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.
customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

parameters.description: The parameters for the FileUploader which are rendered as a hidden input field.
parameters.helpDescription: The parameters for the FileUploader which are rendered as a hidden input field.

dragDropConfig.description: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.
dragDropConfig.helpDescription: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.

valueState.description:
Visualizes warnings or errors related to the text field.

Possible values: Warning, Error, Success, None.
valueState.helpDescription:
Visualizes warnings or errors related to the text field.

Possible values: Warning, Error, Success, None.

valueStateText.description: Custom text for the value state message pop-up. Note: If not specified, a default text, based on the value state type, will be used instead.
valueStateText.helpDescription: Custom text for the value state message pop-up. Note: If not specified, a default text, based on the value state type, will be used instead.

iconOnly.description: If set to true, the button is displayed without any text.
iconOnly.helpDescription: If set to true, the button is displayed without any text.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.
busyIndicatorSize.helpDescription: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

icon.description:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button.

This can be a URI to an image or an icon font URI.
icon.helpDescription:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button.

This can be a URI to an image or an icon font URI.

maximumFileSize.description:
A file size limit in megabytes which prevents the upload if at least one file exceeds it.

This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.
maximumFileSize.helpDescription:
A file size limit in megabytes which prevents the upload if at least one file exceeds it.

This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

maximumFilenameLength.description: The maximum length of a filename which the FileUploader will accept. If the maximum filename length is exceeded, the corresponding event filenameLengthExceed is fired.
maximumFilenameLength.helpDescription: The maximum length of a filename which the FileUploader will accept. If the maximum filename length is exceeded, the corresponding event filenameLengthExceed is fired.

mimeType.description: The chosen files will be checked against an array of mime types. If at least one file does not fit the mime type restriction, the upload is prevented. Note: This property is not supported by Internet Explorer & Microsoft Edge. Example: ["image/png", "image/jpeg"].
mimeType.helpDescription: The chosen files will be checked against an array of mime types. If at least one file does not fit the mime type restriction, the upload is prevented. Note: This property is not supported by Internet Explorer & Microsoft Edge. Example: ["image/png", "image/jpeg"].

iconFirst.description: If set to true (default), the display sequence is 1. icon 2. control text.
iconFirst.helpDescription: If set to true (default), the display sequence is 1. icon 2. control text.

enabled.description: Disabled controls have different colors, depending on customer settings.
enabled.helpDescription: Disabled controls have different colors, depending on customer settings.

uploadOnChange.description: If set to "true", the upload immediately starts after file selection. With the default setting, the upload needs to be explicitly triggered.
uploadOnChange.helpDescription: If set to "true", the upload immediately starts after file selection. With the default setting, the upload needs to be explicitly triggered.

useMultipart.description: If set to "false", the request will be sent as file only request instead of a multipart/form-data request. Only one file could be uploaded using this type of request. Required for sending such a request is to set the property sendXHR to "true". This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.
useMultipart.helpDescription: If set to "false", the request will be sent as file only request instead of a multipart/form-data request. Only one file could be uploaded using this type of request. Required for sending such a request is to set the property sendXHR to "true". This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

blocked.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.
blocked.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.

DeprecatedInfo.description: The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.

busyIndicatorDelay.description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.
busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busy.description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.
busy.helpDescription: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.
fieldGroupIds.helpDescription: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

sendXHR.description:
If set to "true", the request will be sent as XHR request instead of a form submit.

This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.
sendXHR.helpDescription:
If set to "true", the request will be sent as XHR request instead of a form submit.

This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

iconHovered.description:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is hovered (only if also a base icon was specified).

If not specified, the base icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.
iconHovered.helpDescription:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is hovered (only if also a base icon was specified).

If not specified, the base icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

iconSelected.description:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is selected (only if also a base icon was specified).

If not specified, the base or hovered icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.
iconSelected.helpDescription:
Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is selected (only if also a base icon was specified).

If not specified, the base or hovered icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

additionalData.description: Additional data that is sent to the back end service. Data will be transmitted as value of a hidden input where the name is derived from the name property with suffix "-data".
additionalData.helpDescription: Additional data that is sent to the back end service. Data will be transmitted as value of a hidden input where the name is derived from the name property with suffix "-data".

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

value.description: Value of the path for file upload.
value.helpDescription: Value of the path for file upload.

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

buttonText.description: The button's text can be overwritten using this property.
buttonText.helpDescription: The button's text can be overwritten using this property.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

buttonOnly.description: If set to "true", the FileUploader will be rendered as Button only, without showing the input field.
buttonOnly.helpDescription: If set to "true", the FileUploader will be rendered as Button only, without showing the input field.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

sameFilenameAllowed.description:
If the FileUploader is configured to upload the file directly after the file is selected, it is not allowed to upload a file with the same name again. If a user should be allowed to upload a file with the same name again this parameter has to be "true".

A typical use case would be if the files have different paths.
sameFilenameAllowed.helpDescription:
If the FileUploader is configured to upload the file directly after the file is selected, it is not allowed to upload a file with the same name again. If a user should be allowed to upload a file with the same name again this parameter has to be "true".

A typical use case would be if the files have different paths.

multiple.description: Allows multiple files to be chosen and uploaded from the same folder. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9. Note: Keep in mind that the various operating systems for mobile devices can react differently to the property so that fewer upload functions may be available in some cases.
multiple.helpDescription: Allows multiple files to be chosen and uploaded from the same folder. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9. Note: Keep in mind that the various operating systems for mobile devices can react differently to the property so that fewer upload functions may be available in some cases.

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

uploadUrl.description: Used when URL address is on a remote server.
uploadUrl.helpDescription: Used when URL address is on a remote server.

name.description: Unique control name for identification on the server side after sending data to the server.
name.helpDescription: Unique control name for identification on the server side after sending data to the server.

style.description:
Style of the button.

Values "Transparent, "Accept", "Reject", or "Emphasized" are allowed.
style.helpDescription:
Style of the button.

Values "Transparent, "Accept", "Reject", or "Emphasized" are allowed.

fileType.description: The chosen files will be checked against an array of file types. If at least one file does not fit the file type restriction, the upload is prevented. Note: This property is not supported by Microsoft Edge. Example: ["jpg", "png", "bmp"].
fileType.helpDescription: The chosen files will be checked against an array of file types. If at least one file does not fit the file type restriction, the upload is prevented. Note: This property is not supported by Microsoft Edge. Example: ["jpg", "png", "bmp"].

uploadComplete.name: uploadComplete
uploadComplete.description: Event is fired as soon as the upload request is completed (either successful or unsuccessful). To see if the upload request was successful, check the status parameter for a value 2xx. The actual progress of the upload can be monitored by listening to the uploadProgress event. However, this covers only the client side of the upload process and does not give any success status from the server.
uploadComplete.helpDescription: Event is fired as soon as the upload request is completed (either successful or unsuccessful). To see if the upload request was successful, check the status parameter for a value 2xx. The actual progress of the upload can be monitored by listening to the uploadProgress event. However, this covers only the client side of the upload process and does not give any success status from the server.
uploadComplete.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

uploadProgress.name: uploadProgress
uploadProgress.description: Event is fired after the upload has started and before the upload is completed. It contains progress information related to the running upload. Depending on file size, band width and used browser the event is fired once or multiple times. This event is only supported with property sendXHR set to true, i.e. the event is not supported in Internet Explorer 9.

sap.ui.unified.CalendarMonthInterval.description: Calendar with granularity of months displayed in one line. Note: JavaScript Date objects are used to set and return the months, mark them as selected or as a special type. But the date part of the Date object is not used. If a Date object is returned the date will be set to the 1st of the corresponding month.

sap.ui.unified.CalendarMonthInterval.helpDescription: Calendar with granularity of months displayed in one line. Note: JavaScript Date objects are used to set and return the months, mark them as selected or as a special type. But the date part of the Date object is not used. If a Date object is returned the date will be set to the 1st of the corresponding month.

selectedDates.description: Date ranges for selected dates of the CalendarMonthInterval. If singleSelection is set, only the first entry is used. Note: Even if only one day is selected, the whole corresponding month is selected.
selectedDates.helpDescription: Date ranges for selected dates of the CalendarMonthInterval. If singleSelection is set, only the first entry is used. Note: Even if only one day is selected, the whole corresponding month is selected.

specialDates.description: Date ranges with type to visualize special months in the CalendarMonthInterval. If one day is assigned to more than one type, only the first one will be used. Note: Even if only one day is set as a special day, the whole corresponding month is displayed in this way.
specialDates.helpDescription: Date ranges with type to visualize special months in the CalendarMonthInterval. If one day is assigned to more than one type, only the first one will be used. Note: Even if only one day is set as a special day, the whole corresponding month is displayed in this way.

sap.ui.unified.CalendarLegend.description: A legend for the Calendar Control. Displays special dates colors with their corresponding description. The aggregation specialDates can be set herefor.
sap.ui.unified.CalendarLegend.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CalendarLegend. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getStandardItems standardItems} : string[] (default: Today,Selected,WorkingDay,NonWorkingDay)
    • {@link #getColumnWidth columnWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 120px)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.unified.CalendarLegendItem[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.CalendarLegend.helpDescription: A legend for the Calendar Control. Displays special dates colors with their corresponding description. The aggregation specialDates can be set herefor.

sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase.description: Abstract base class for menu item which provides common properties and events for all concrete item implementations.
sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase.constructorDescription:
Abstract base class MenuItemBase for menu item elements. Please use concrete subclasses. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getStartsSection startsSection} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSubmenu submenu} : sap.ui.unified.Menu (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.MenuItemBase.helpDescription: Abstract base class for menu item which provides common properties and events for all concrete item implementations.

sap.ui.unified.ShellOverlay.description: ShellOverlay to be opened in front of an sap.ui.unified.Shell
sap.ui.unified.ShellOverlay.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ShellOverlay. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
    • {@link #getSearch search} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Associations
    • {@link #getShell shell} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.unified.ShellLayout)
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:closed closed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.unified.ShellOverlay.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.44.0 undefined
ShellOverlay to be opened in front of an sap.ui.unified.Shell

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

busyIndicatorDelay.description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.
busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. validateFieldGroup.name: validateFieldGroup
validateFieldGroup.description: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or when the user explicitly pressed the key combination that triggers validation. By default, the RETURN key without any modifier keys triggers validation, see {@link #triggerValidateFieldGroup}. Listen to this event to validate data of the controls belonging to a field group. See {@link #setFieldGroupIds}, or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.
